This region is renowned as a premier destination for golf enthusiasts, featuring vibrant communities centered around the sport. In addition to its top-tier golf courses, Southwest Florida is home to some of the best golf stores and PGA teaching professionals, providing comprehensive resources for golfers of all skill levels. Private Golf Clubs Private Golf Clubs Explore more than 200 private golf clubs from Naples to Sarasota. Learn More Public Golf Clubs Public Golf Clubs Southwest Florida is home to some of the best golf courses in the state. Explore more than 25 public golf courses in the area. Learn More Golf Lessons Golf Lessons PGA Teaching professionals offering top-tier golf lessons in Southwest Florida. learn More Golf Stores Golf Stores Southwest Florida boasts a wide variety of golf stores catering to enthusiasts of all levels. Find a store near you. learn More About Naples Golf Guy For expert guidance in Southwest Florida real estate, contact Naples Golf Guy, Matt Klinowski P.A. Whether you’re looking to buy a single-family home or condo in Naples, Bonita Springs, Estero, Ft. Myers or Sarasota I can help. With over 20 years of experience, I offer valuable market information and insights into individual communities to help you find the perfect home and lifestyle in the best golf community to fit your needs. Reach out to me today to get started! Bonita Fairways Property Search Golf Communities Naples Bonita Springs / Estero Fort Myers Greater Sarasota Bundled Equity Luxury Buyers Sellers Discover SWFL FAQ’s Dinning & Entertainment Shopping Beaches Calendar of Events Golf Accommodations Healthcare Arts & Attractions About Us Naples Golf Guy Team Downing Frye Realty Contact Us Testimonials Blog Property Search Golf Communities Naples Bonita Springs / Estero Fort Myers Greater Sarasota Bundled Equity Luxury Buyers Sellers Discover SWFL FAQ’s Dinning & Entertainment Shopping Beaches Calendar of Events Golf Accommodations Healthcare Arts & Attractions About Us Naples Golf Guy Team Downing Frye Realty Contact Us Testimonials Blog 239.370.0892 info@naplesgolfguy.com Back to Bonita Springs / Estero Golf Communities Bonita Fairways Golf Club Bonita Fairways Golf Club in an executive golf course in Bonita Springs, Florida. Gordon Lewis designed the 3400-yard, par 61, 18-hole course which is open to the public. The beauty of the course is that it challenges your short game as well as your long game. There are seven par 4’s; the remainder are par 3’s. The back nine feature Florida-style hills and valleys, sand traps, and several small waterholes. The front nine keep you on your toes with larger waterholes, sand traps, and doglegs–all surrounded by a pristine nature preserve. When the game is over, stop by One More Round for a delicious lunch, a cool drink, or just a little friendly conversation. A course that’s perfect for all ages and levels. Bonita Fairways is one of the few golf communities offering new condos in a new neighborhood called Botanika. This new construction development is a three-building, 75-unit enclave offering buyers a selection of seven different floor plans ranging from a one-bedroom plus den up to a three-bedroom unit. Botanika residents will have access to their own exclusive clubhouse while also having access to the greater amenities of Bonita Fairways. In addition to the golf course, residents have access to a resort-style pool, a spa, tennis courts, pickleball, bocce ball and state of the art fitness center. Bottom Line The Naples Golf Guy Team specializes in helping buyers and sellers with their real estate needs in Southwest Florida Golf Communities. Contact us today for more information. Location: Bonita Springs, Florida Club Type: Semi-Private Membership Type: Pay as you play Real Estate Home Price Ranges Single Family: $460,000 – $700,000 View Homes for Sale Condos: $350,000 – $612,000 View Condos for Sale The Naples Golf Guy Team has more than 20 years of experience helping Buyers and Sellers with their real estate needs in Southwest Florida. Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. Reviewed January 31, 2024 Jimmy Lynn – President of Lifestyle Management Group of Florida – has come a long way since we first met in 2011. After spending 10 years in the golf industry, running sales and marketing for the largest publisher of golf travel information in the world, I had taken a position outside of golf but was still doing a little writing about golf courses and equipment. On the occasions I was sent some equipment, I would head over to the driving range at Gateway Golf and Country Club. I had worked out a deal with then General Manager, Jimmy Lynn, mentioning his club’s facilities in those earlier articles. Our friendship grew and we ended up playing a fair amount of golf together. Life happened; Jimmy moved to a club down in Naples and I relocated to Lakeland to be closer to family. Fast forward 12 years and we both have new, successful career paths. Jimmy found an investor and they created Lifestyle Management Group of Florida which owns and/or manages four clubs in Southwest Florida:  The Club at Westminster, Quail Creek Village, Bonita Fairways, and The Club at Gateway. As a management company, LMGOF’s goal is to elevate each private club and make them relevant in every aspect of services, facilities, and finances, thus creating sustainability for the long term with elating membership. In the words of Jimmy Lynn, Bonita Fairways Golf Club in Bonita Springs “Is an amazing success story. During the season, the tee sheets are always full, and the Cafe is packed.” The par 61, 3500-yard golf course was designed by Gordon Lewis and is anything but a pushover with six holes in the 300-yard range. The golf course is surrounded by a nature preserve and the lakes that you’ll encounter as you play your way around the course will challenge both your short game and your long game as well! The course was renovated in the summer of 2021, and with its impeccable conditioning, it’s the perfect place to enjoy a quick round of golf with family and friends. Before your round, warm up your short game and putting stroke on the full-size putting green. There’s a fully stocked pro shop in case you need any last-minute necessities, and the Bobcat Café can handle your thirst and hunger before and after your round. Lifestyle Management Group of Florida has proven to be a top-notch golf management company in SW Florida. Lynn adds “We don’t want to be a big company but only want to be truly hands-on in all things we do and partner with the clubs we manage. If you need help or just want to talk shop please call Jimmy Lynn at 813-767-3855. I’ve known Jimmy for a long time and one thing is certain, he always delivers! Good things will come from Jimmy Lynn and his staff at LMGOF. Read More Michael Z. Reviewed February 21, 2011 Felt like robbed by poor service.  Booked tee time 3:03 by telephone call.  Specified we will do 18 holes.  Paid at the clubhouse for 18 holes, never got to 1st tee until 3:20.  Finished the front 9 by 5:05 because it was so cramped only to fined out the clubhouse had closed... could not use any washroom facilities which are none existing on the course.  Never got any further than the 10th hole because it was getting darker and we were busting at the bladder... It was alright to take our money and disappear at 5 o'clock sharp.  The course is not bad but I WOULD DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMEND IT BECAUSE OF THE POOR SERVICE.  Even on line booking tee times specifies past 4 o'clock bookings!!!!!  The person at the clubhouse must have known for sure how busy it was... the starter knew.
